params.collateral: set true if the asset is considered a collateral token
params.foreignToken: ERC20 contract must not be registered
params.oracle: must be at least one USD oracle for every asset so supply the first one for the new asset

params.module: deployed module must not be registered and must emit the expected fingerprint
params.moduleType: the type number of the module type
params.name: descriptive module information has no bearing on logic
params.url: optionally point to human-readable operational description

assignOracle(address,address).details: foreign tokens have 1-n registered oracle options which are selected by oneToken instance governance

params.foreignToken: ERC20 contract address must be registered already
params.oracle: USD oracle must be registered. Oracle must return quote in a registered collateral (USD) token.

deployOneTokenProxy(string,string,addres.details: the new uninitialized instance has a finalized deployment address and is owned by the factory

params.collateral: deployed ERC20 contract must be registered with at least one associated oracle
params.governance: address that will control admin functions in the oneToken instance
params.memberToken: deployed ERC20 contract must be registered with at least one associated oracle
params.name: ERC20 token name
params.oneTokenOracle: deployed oracle must be registered and will be used to check the oneToken peg
params.version: address of a oneToken deployed implementation that emits the expected fingerprint

foreignTokenCount().details: includes memberTokens, otherTokens and collateral tokens but not oneTokens

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeForeignToken(address).details: de-registering prevents future assignment but has no effect on existing oneToken instances that rely on the foreignToken

params.foreignToken: the ERC20 contract address to de-register

removeModule(address).details: de-registering has no effect on oneTokens that use the module

removeOracle(address,address).details: unassociating the oracle with a given asset prevents assignment but does not affect oneToken instances that use it

params.foreignToken: the ERC20 contract to disassociate with the oracle
params.oracle: the oracle to remove from the foreignToken

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateForeignToken(address,bool).details: changes do not affect classification in existing oneToken instances

params.collateral: set to true to include in collateral

params.module: deployed module must be registered. moduleType cannot be changed
params.name: descriptive module information has no bearing on logic
params.url: optionally point to human-readable operational description

admitForeignToken(address,bool,address).notice: factory governance can add a foreign token to the inventory

admitModule(address,uint8,string,string).notice: factory governance can register a module

assignOracle(address,address).notice: factory governance can assign an oracle to foreign token

deployOneTokenProxy(string,string,addres.notice: factory governance can deploy a oneToken instance via new proxy using existing deployed implementation

foreignTokenAtIndex(uint256).notice: returns the address of the foreignToken at the index

foreignTokenCount().notice: returns count of foreignTokens registered with the factory

foreignTokenInfo(address).notice: returns foreignToken metadata for the given foreignToken

foreignTokenOracleAtIndex(address,uint25.notice: returns the foreignToken oracle address at the index

foreignTokenOracleCount(address).notice: returns the count of oracles registered for the given foreignToken

isCollateral(address).notice: returns true if the given foreignToken is marked collateral

isForeignToken(address).notice: returns true if the given foreignToken is registered in the factory

isModule(address).notice: returns true the given address is a registered module

isOneToken(address).notice: return true if given address is a deployed and initialized oneToken instance

isOracle(address,address).notice: returns true if the given oracle address is associated with the foreignToken

isValidModuleType(address,uint8).notice: returns true the address given is a registered module of the expected type

moduleAtIndex(uint256).notice: returns the address of the registered module at the index

moduleCount().notice: returns the count of the registered modules

oneTokenAtIndex(uint256).notice: returns the address of the deployed/initialized oneToken instance at the index

oneTokenCount().notice: returns the count of deployed and initialized oneToken instances

removeForeignToken(address).notice: factory governance can de-register a foreignToken

removeModule(address).notice: factory governance can de-register a module

removeOracle(address,address).notice: factory can decommission an oracle associated with a particular asset

updateForeignToken(address,bool).notice: factory governance can update asset metadata

updateModule(address,string,string).notice: factory governance can update module metadata
